author: News Desk
title: 2025 set to be among warmest years
text: 2025 is set to be one of the hottest years, following record heat in 2024, highlighting urgent climate concerns.

author: Greg Kennelty
title: Some Dude Proposed To His Girlfriend At A FROZEN SOUL Show In Sweden
text:
[Frozen Soul](/tag/frozen-soul)'s recent show at the Kollektivet Livet Bar & Scen in Stockholm took a turn for the romantic. [Frozen Soul](/tag/frozen-soul) fan Jesper proposed to his longtime girlfriend Marie on stage, and she said yes! Though I guess [Frozen Soul](/tag/frozen-soul) wouldn't have posted the video if she said no – that would be kind of a dick move and really ruin the vibe.
"Congratulations to Jesper and Marie on their engagement, Jesper had the guts to get on stage at [Kollektivet Livet Bar & Scen] during our set in front of a packed crowd to propose to his love Marie and she said yes!!" said
[Frozen Soul](/tag/frozen-soul) on their Instagram. "Truly beautiful, it made our first time in Sweden even more amazing we can’t wait to get back!"
[Frozen Soul](/tag/frozen-soul) also has a bunch of dates lined up for North America this April with [Amon Amarth](/tag/amon-amarth), [Cannibal Corpse](/tag/cannibal-corpse), and [Obituary](/tag/obituary) – just in case you're looking for proposal ideas. Check 'em out below and get your tickets right here.

Un 97,2% de la mano de obra 'huye' de la construcción y pone al sector sobre el filo de la navaja
por
Dragstat
a
eleconomista.es
enviado:
____
El rechazo a jornadas, horarios, sueldos o "penosidad" de los trabajos está provocando la "fuga de talento" en la construcción, así como en hostelería y comercio. Ello hace que "no resulte atractivo para muchos jóvenes, lo que agrava la dificultad", sobre todo en un contexto de envejecimiento de la mano de obra, especialmente relevante en actividades que exigen un elevado esfuerzo físico. Las patronales hablan de una carencia de casi 700.000 profesionales. Está por ver si el nuevo reglamento de extranjería propicia la inyección de profesionales
|

author: 通讯员 夏姝姝
title: 文化礼堂变身科学实验室 黄岩院桥"春泥"育新苗-台州频道
text:
近日，黄岩区院桥镇沙门村文化礼堂里，一场以“科学秀”为主题的暑期课堂正热热闹闹地展开。20余名托管儿童整齐地坐好，目光紧紧锁定讲台——这里没有花哨道具，只有烧杯、小苏打、气球和金属棒，却让孩子们眼睛发亮。
戴彩色假发的指导老师举起燃烧的金属棒，灿烂的火焰瞬间蹿起，像两簇跳动的火苗。“哇！”孩子们不约而同喊出声。这是“火焰变色术”实验，金属粉末遇火显色的原理，就这么直观地展现在眼前。
随后，“火山爆发”实验台同样吸睛：小苏打与白醋在塑料瓶里“咕嘟咕嘟”冒泡，泡沫顺着模拟“火山坡”的纸板缓缓淌下，几个孩子踮脚伸手轻轻碰了碰，又笑着缩回：“是凉的！”
最热闹的要数“静电精灵”环节，老师摩擦气球后靠近碎纸片，纸片“唰”地飞起来；扎羊角辫的小女孩学着操作，发梢沾着的纸片随着跑动轻颤，周围孩子追着喊：“看！我的头发也带电了！”
科学实验课刚结束，同一间活动室的长桌已换了模样——木板上、齿轮、车轮散落一地，志愿者正忙着分发材料：“暑期开始后，我们保证每节课都留手工时间，锻炼动手能力。”带队的志愿者边说边帮孩子调整螺丝，“课程设计前专门问过孩子们兴趣，动手环节多，比单纯讲课管用。”
桌上散落的木板、车轮、螺丝刀很快被孩子们“占领”：有的用砂纸打磨木板毛边，有的把车轮卡进齿轮槽，还有的举着螺丝刀喊：“老师，这个螺丝滑丝了！”不一会儿，十几辆造型各异的小车停在桌面——有的车身刷着蓝色条纹，有的车轮装得歪歪扭扭，却都转动得“咔嗒咔嗒”响。
课程尾声，孩子们举着自己组装的小车围到投影幕布前。背景墙上，中国国旗与党旗端正悬挂，“文化礼堂”的牌匾泛着暖光，幕布上“科学秀”三个字依然醒目。“老师，我长大想造能治病的机器人！”一个小男孩举着小车喊。镜头里，孩子们的笑脸和小车的彩漆交相辉映，连最腼腆的小女孩都踮起脚，把小车举得老高……
院桥镇“春泥计划”以“科普+文化+实践”课程体系为抓手，镇宣传办牵头整合科协、学校、非遗代表性传承人等资源，将科学实验的趣味、文化传承的厚重融入暑期托管，为孩子打造“第二课堂”——既动手探知科学奥秘，又触摸文化脉搏，在实践中实现成长与浸润。精心的设计不仅破解暑期儿童“看护难”问题，更以文化礼堂为土壤播下“爱科学、传文化”的种子。下一步，院桥镇将持续深耕青少年需求，拓展课程形式，让“春泥计划”成为滋养童心的沃土，为社会培育未来人才、激发振兴活力注入强劲动力。
浙江在线台州频道责任编辑： 张丹萍

author: Steven Ertelt
title: Mom Fights Oregon After State Prevents Her From Adopting Because She’s a Christian - LifeNews.com
text:
A single mother of five is fighting the Oregon Department of Human Services denying her adoption application due to her religious beliefs.
Jessica Bates, a Christian mom who lost her husband in a car crash six years ago, attempted to apply with the department to adopt children in 2022. Oregon officials denied Bates’ application because her Christian beliefs would not allow her to “respect, accept, and support … the sexual orientation, gender identity, [and] gender expression” of the children in her care as the department’s adoption regulations require, according to a lawsuit brought by Alliance Defending Freedom.
The 41-page lawsuit explained that Bates hoped to adopt a “sibling pair” that are both under the age of 10 and began applying in March 2022. Bates said that during the trainings for the adoption she “realized that her faith might conflict with some of the Department’s expectations for adoptive parents.”
During one of the trainings, an instructor noted that Oregon law required adoptive parents to “affirm” a child’s gender identity, sexual orientation and preferred pronouns, according to the lawsuit. Prospective parents are also barred from sharing beliefs that do not promote these values.
A lower court ruled against her and now Bates is appealing to the 9th Circuit to allow Bates to access Oregon’s adoption system free of discrimination while her lawsuit continues so that she can provide a loving home to children in need.
HELP LIFENEWS SAVE BABIES FROM ABORTION! Please help LifeNews.com with a donation !
“No state should abandon children in favor of a dangerous ideological agenda,” said ADF Legal Counsel Johannes Widmalm-Delphonse. “Jessica is a loving mother who feels called to adopt siblings under the age of 10 from foster care. But the state of Oregon is categorically excluding her from adopting any child because Jessica shares a view held by millions of Americans: that boys and girls are biologically different and should cherish that difference, not reject it. Because Jessica will not promote Oregon’s radical gender ideology to children under the age of 10, the state considers her an unfit parent and has deprived hundreds, if not thousands, of children in Oregon’s system of the opportunity to be raised in a loving home. We urge the 9th Circuit to allow Jessica to continue her adoption journey and provide a loving home to children in need.”
Although Jessica repeatedly told ODHS officials that she would happily love and accept any child placed with her, officials still rejected her application, making her ineligible to adopt any child—even children who share Jessica’s religious beliefs. ODHS’s policy needlessly penalizes Bates and many other people of faith for their religious views, compels parents to speak words that violate their conscience, and deprives religious families of equal protection of the law because of their faith.
Bates, who lost her husband in a car collision six years ago, is a mother of five children, ages 10 to 18. Inspired by the story of a man who adopted a child from foster care, Bates felt a calling to follow the biblical teaching to care for orphans. State officials, however, rejected her application because she refused to abandon her religious beliefs.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 畜牧养殖ETF（516670）跌1.07%，半日成交额1394.66万元|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，畜牧养殖ETF（516670）跌1.07%，报0.648元，成交额1394.66万元。畜牧养殖ETF（516670）重仓股方面， 海大集团 截止午盘跌0.14%， 温氏股份 跌0.58%， 牧原股份 跌0.56%， 新希望 跌1.27%， 梅花生物 跌0.09%， 大北农 跌0.99%， 圣农发展 跌0.90%， 生物股份 跌2.55%， 唐人神 跌1.67%， 天康生物 跌1.29%。
畜牧养殖ETF（516670）业绩比较基准为中证畜牧养殖指数收益率，管理人为招商基金管理有限公司，基金经理为刘重杰，成立（2021-03-18）以来回报为-34.59%，近一个月回报为1.19%。

author: Redacción Canal N
title: Ministra de Turismo insta a mineros a desbloquear carretera
text:
Ministra Desilú León exhorta a mineros a liberar la carretera
La titular del Mincetur hizo un llamado al diálogo e instó a los mineros a liberar la zona subrayando el impacto negativo que tienen sobre sectores clave como la agricultura y la ganadería.
La ministra de Comercio Exterior y Turismo, Desilú León, se pronunció sobre los bloqueos de carreteras en el sur por parte de
[mineros informales.](https://canaln.pe/peru/transportistas-se-enfrentaron-mineros-informales-n478704)
En declaraciones a la prensa, la titular del Mincetur hizo un llamado al diálogo e instó a los mineros a liberar la zona subrayando el impacto negativo que tienen sobre sectores clave como la agricultura y la ganadería.
En las regiones de Ica y Arequipa, los agricultores enfrentan serias dificultades para transportar sus productos, lo que perjudica el comercio interno y amenaza la estabilidad económica de la zona.
Según la ministra, se está evaluando el impacto económico de estos bloqueos, considerando la cantidad de contenedores retenidos, el tiempo de detención y las posibles pérdidas económicas, especialmente si se trata de productos perecibles como frutas.
Mejoras al complejo arqueológico de Chan Chan
En paralelo, la ministra inauguró mejoras en el complejo arqueológico de Chan Chan, en Trujillo, con el objetivo de impulsar el turismo.
Las obras incluyen cobertores para proteger la plaza ceremonial, mejoras en los accesos peatonales desde el museo y la construcción de un mirador turístico, iniciativas que buscan enriquecer la experiencia de los visitantes y proteger el patrimonio cultural.

author: Carlos Cristian Flores
title: RMU leaves for Cleveland as team prepares for NCAA Tournament
text:
RMU leaves for Cleveland as team prepares to take on Alabama in NCAA Tournament
The Robert Morris Colonials left for Cleveland Wednesday in hopes of making history as they take on the No. 2 seeded Alabama Crimson Tide in the first round of the NCAA tournament.
"We can talk here, about like 20 minutes or 1 hour about Alabama. What Alabama does. What Alabama can do. What Alabama can not do sometimes. We can talk here for hours but I think the key is us," Alvaro Folgueiras said.
"I mean, just look at what we've done. All year we've been count out all year. But, you know, it's a basketball game. At the end of day, we all lace up the same way; we have been playing since we were kids and (now we are going to be) on a bigger stage. A bigger stage. So, you know, it's going to be a dogfight," Guard DJ Smith said.
Forward Amarion Dickerson touched on playing in his hometown of Cleveland, Ohio.
"It means a lot. I always want to embrace it anytime that I'll be able to go home and play in front of a whole crowd. Play in front of everyone in the family. You know, my friends, everybody watched me growing up. Everybody had a hand, helping me get to where I'm at right now. So, it definitely means a lot to me. I really just focus on trying to just work," Dickerson said.
RMU came off an electric season, finishing the best record in the Horizon League and winning the Horizon League tournament to punch their ticket into the NCAA Tournament.
However, for Head Coach Andy Toole, that’s in the past, and all eyes are on Friday’s game.
"You know, just keep working. Keep preparing. I don't think we've done anything differently than we would have a week ago. Two weeks ago, or six weeks ago. And that's kind of what we talked about with our team is, hey, we got practice. And so, we got to practice. You know, we got to flip the switch from cloud nine, as you mentioned, to, you know, preparation," Toole said.
With the team representing western Pennsylvania in the big dance, the buzz around Moon Township is also alive and growing.
"Oh, it's fantastic because their reputation as a university is well known and respected and a beautiful campus. So maybe this introduction to the country will bring more people to the university," Jim Wagner said.
John Loub with Primanti Brothers said they already prepared to have additional staff come in on game day to deal with the influx of people.
" Yeah, anytime that you can have a local team, whether it's Pitt, Duquesne or RMU, it's awesome to see that. And the fact that RMU hasn't been there for the last ten years and now gets back into the big dance, it's really cool," Loub said.
